titles: The loyal forrister, or, Royal pastime; Being a pleasant discourse between the king and a loyal keeper, who not knowing his majesty, would not suffer him to hunt in the forrest for any reward whatsoever ... To an excellent new tune.
notes: Place and date of publication taken from Wing (2nd ed.)
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
keywords: William --  III, --  King of England, 1650-1702. --  Poetry.
Mary --  II, --  Queen of England, 1662-1694 --  Poetry.
